comments.author: Unknowntyper

comments.text:
The name would likely have been closer to 'Colburt' than 'Colbear' when it 
was first largely adopted by French speakers.  The French adapted the name, 
from either German or Latin depending on who you ask, which would have had 
the name as Colberht or Colibert - from Colibertus, free slave - 
respectively.

Point being, 'Colburt' isn't necessarily an Anglicised pronunciation as the 
name is either Anglican in origin or from a Latin word that would have had 
a spoken T anyway.

comments.text:
+andotech It's not about who the biggest victim is... that's not how victim 
culture works. Demonizing a demographic as being something hateful and 
then casting any or all out groups to that demonized demographic as 
victimized 'objects' increases power for the out group. Now they (the out 
group(s)) feel they have every right to self righteous indignation. The 
Demonized group has no avenue to take but concession because attempts to 
reason with the victim group are seen as a means to further oppression. If 
the Demonized group follows a policy of appeasement... then it will never 
be enough.

The old white men out there were some of the people that were quite active 
in the sixties... they wanted to make the world a better place for 
everyone. Sure they had limited success but the world we live in now has a 
lot more equality of opportunity than the world that preceded them.

This is the side show though... while we bicker back and forth on line... 
there are people paid big money to dream up contentious issues that will 
divide the populace and keep us at each other. These think tanks then give 
their ideas to corporate PR firms that start promotional campaigns that 
stir the pot. We are embroiled in a war for oil and trade lanes right 
now... the topic du jour isn't: "How can we stop relying on petroleum so 
much." but instead it is: "Is climate change a hoax or not." We can't even 
address the fundamental problem because we are tied in knots about the 
controversial climate change hoax issue. Who the fuck cares if it is a hoax 
or not... bringing on alternative energy would reduce energy costs for all. 
Where is the endless dialogue about that?

The real world isn't divided between left wingers and right wingers so much 
as it is divided between populists and corporatists.
When corporatists on the left and right pass endless pro-corporate policy 
everyone loses... but instead of blaming the corporate slant of the 
policies... the populace on the right and left blame the policy for being 
too right wing or too left wing. Bullshit... it was too corporatist. Most 
of us would celebrate populist policy whether it came from the right or the 
left.

Now back to the original comment. When you see comments that blame certain 
groups for things that that group clearly isn't responsible for... or the 
soul agent in... then you are seeing someone demonizing that group. Whether 
or not this perspective came directly from a PR campaign or not is beside 
the point. The real issue is that it is divisive... and it tickles our war 
nerve about a side show... rather than helps us focus on a real issue. We 
should blame a specific non responsible demographic. Instead we should 
attack bigotry and how it is used in propaganda to divide us.
